job-item.job-description: I was lucky to be involved in the digital transformation of Tesco Bank's brochureware website from day one. I worked as the lead Designer on several business-critical projects, delivering e2e high-performing CMS-driven brochureware journeys.
job-item.job-verbose:
My day-to-day work involved producing:

  • IAs, journey maps and page frameworks
  • Wireframes and interactive prototypes
  • User testing (online, usability)
  • Visual/UI design of new CMS widgets and components
  • Detailed interaction specs (including providing CSS/JavaScript prototypes to illustrate interaction patterns, animations and transitions)

job-item.job-company: Sky Customer Business Systems via Comet Global Consulting
job-item.job-description: My role and responsibilities in Comet have constantly evolved and grown from the day I joined the company. In just 18 months I became one of their key resources on the BSkyB account, and my work with this client has created a number of new opportunities for Comet to engage in new areas of Sky's Technology Department.
My task was to implement a TSQL code parser and graph analysis tool to automate code analysis tasks	in the Stock-Loan Team.
job-item.job-verbose: The project was selected as one of the 12 candidates to represent the Budapest IT Department on the company-wide MS Tech Expo 2008 in London that year, and presented to the Heads of Department.

job-item.job-description: I was responsible for creating IT solutions for media artists working in project teams for Kitchen Budapest's big launch show and initial projects.
job-item.job-verbose: I worked as part of an international team of 20 on various new media projects including circuit hacking, Arduino, procedural graphics and Processing, web development and graphic design tasks. I even worked with the very first prototype of prezi.com!
